member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for complex object creation.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Builders.Builder.Of
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for complex object creation.
member.example: Builder.Of.Users()... .Build() where .Exceotion() returns a custom builder of user instances.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Builders.Builder.For
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for complex object creation.
member.example: Builder.For.User()... .Build() where .Exception() returns a custom builder of user instances.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must
member.summary: Allows easy extensibility of assertions for testing frameworks.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(2, Must.Be.Even()) where .Even() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.ContainEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for elements of a group, for example, collections.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.NotContainEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for elements of a group, for example, collections.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Contain
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for elements of a group, for example, collections.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(new[]{1, 2, 3}, Must.Contain.ASingleEvenNumber()) where .ASingleEvenNumber() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.HaveEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for elements of a group, for example, a property out of many.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.NotHaveEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for elements of a group, for example, a property out of many.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Have
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for elements of a group, for example, a property out of many.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(aUri, Must.Have.Query()) where .Query() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.BeEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for individual elements.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.NotBeEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for individual elements.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Be
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for individual elements.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(2, Must.Be.Even()) where .Even() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.SatisfyEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for constraints of individual elements.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.NotSatisfyEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for constraints of individual elements.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Satisfy
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for constraints of individual elements.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(collection, Must.Satisfy.Uniqueness()) where .Uniqueness() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.MatchEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for partial constraints of individual elements.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.NotMatchEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for partial constraints of individual elements.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Match
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for partial constraints of individual elements.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That("asd", Must.Match.String("as*")) where .String() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.RaiseEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for constraints for event raising types.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.NotRaiseEntryPoint
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for constraints for event raising types.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Raise
member.summary: Allows meaningful extensions for types raising events.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(()=>instance.Property = value, Must.Raise.SomeEvent(instance, i => i.Property)).

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Must.Not
member.summary: Allows easy extensibility of negative assertions for testing frameworks.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(2, Must.Not.Be.Even()) where .Even() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Not.Contain
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for elements of a group, for example, collections.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(new[]{1, 3, 5}, Must.Not.Contain.ASingleEvenNumber()) where .ASingleEvenNumber() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Not.Have
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for elements of a group, for example, a property out of many.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(aUri, Must.Not.Have.Query()) where .Query() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Not.Be
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for individual elements.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(3, Must.Not.Be.Even()) where .Even() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Not.Satisfy
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for constraints of individual elements.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(collection, Must.Not.Satisfy.Uniqueness()) where .Uniqueness() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Not.Match
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for partial constraints of individual elements.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That("asd", Must.Not.Match.String("ds*")) where .String() returns a custom assertion.

member.name: P:Testing.Commons.Must.Not.Raise
member.summary: Allows meaningful negative extensions for constraints for event raising types.
member.example: In NUnit: Assert.That(()=>instance.Property = value, Must.Not.Raise.SomeEvent(instance, i => i.Property)).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

true to ignore the interface upon serialization and ignore unexpected data upon deserialization; otherwise, false. The default is false.

true to emit type information; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Serialization.JsonString
member.summary: Allows easier creation of JSON strings by removing the need to scape quotes.
member.remarks:
A compact JSON string notation uses single quotes for names and string values instead of double quotes, removing the need to escape such double quotes.
And expanded JSON string uses the canonical double quote style for names an string values.
member.example: The string "{\"property\"=\"value\"}" can be written as "{'property'='value'}"

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Serialization.JsonString.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a instance of an easier to write JSON string.
member.param: Compact JSON string (single quotes instead of scaped double quotes)

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Serialization.JsonString.ToString
member.summary: Returns the non-compact version of the compact JSON string provided.
member.returns: The expanded JSON.

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Serialization.JsonString.op_Implicit(Testing.Commons.Serialization.JsonString)~System.String
member.summary: Returns the expanded version of the compact JSON string provided.
member.param: The compact JSON string.

member.name: F:Testing.Commons.Serialization.JsonString.Comparer
member.summary: Allows comparing expanded JSON strings to compact JSON ones.
member.remarks:
A compact JSON string notation uses single quotes for names and string values instead of double quotes, removing the need to escape such double quotes.
An expanded JSON string uses the canonical double quote style for names an string values.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Serialization.JsonStringExtensions
member.summary: Provides extensions to facilite the usage of .

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Serialization.JsonStringExtensions.Jsonify(System.String)
member.summary: Expands a compact JSON string into its expanded JSON representation.
member.remarks:
A compact JSON string notation uses single quotes for names and string values instead of double quotes, removing the need to escape such double quotes.
An extended JSON string uses the canonical double quote style for names an string values.
member.param: JSON string in compact form.
member.returns: The expanded JSON.

member.name: T:Testing.Commons.Web.ControlLifecycle
member.summary: Eases testing implementations of .
member.remarks: Controls react to different events during their lifecycle. Those events are usually raisedv by implementations of protected methods and, therefore, cannot be directly invoked from outside the class. By hiding the complexity of those reflection calls, testing of controls is easier to achieve.

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Web.ControlLifecycle.Fake``1(``0,System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Simulates the raise of a given event in a strongly-typed fashion.
member.remarks:
In reality, when the event is fired, some methods in the implementation are called.
When testing, the non-public method that would be called when the real event fired is called using reflection with default values for each argument.
member.param: The subject of the test.
The event that we want to simulate.
member.typeparam: Type of the subject of the test.

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Web.ControlLifecycle.Fake``1(``0,System.Action{``0},System.Object[])
member.summary: Simulates the raise of a given event in a strongly-typed fashion.
member.remarks:
In reality, when the event is fired, some methods in the implementation are called.
When testing, the non-public method that would be called when the real event fired is called using reflection with the provided argument values.
member.param: The subject of the test.
The event that we want to simulate.
Arguments for the non-public method that will be called when the event is simulated.
member.typeparam: Type of the subject of the test.

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Web.ControlLifecycle.Call``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Calls a non-public method directly.
member.remarks: Sometimes, important methods are not the direct result of an event and yet they are called during the lyfecycle of the control. This method eases calling them with default values for each argument.
member.typeparam: Type of the subject of the test.
member.param: The subject of the test.
Name of the method to invoke.

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Web.ControlLifecycle.Call``1(``0,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls a non-public method directly.
member.remarks: Sometimes, important methods are not the direct result of an event and yet they are called during the lyfecycle of the control. This method eases calling them with default values for each argument.
member.typeparam: Type of the subject of the test.
member.param: The subject of the test.
Name of the method to invoke.
Arguments of the method.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, deletes profile properties and information for the supplied list of profiles.
member.returns: The number of profiles deleted from the data source.
member.param: A of information about profiles that are to be deleted.

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Web.ProfileTestProvider.DeleteProfiles(System.String[])
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, deletes profile properties and information for profiles that match the supplied list of user names.
member.returns: The number of profiles deleted from the data source.
member.param: A string array of user names for profiles to be deleted.

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Web.ProfileTestProvider.DeleteInactiveProfiles(System.Web.Profile.ProfileAuthenticationOption,System.DateTime)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, deletes all user-profile data for profiles in which the last activity date occurred before the specified date.
member.returns: The number of profiles deleted from the data source.
member.param: One of the values, specifying whether anonymous, authenticated, or both types of profiles are deleted.
A that identifies which user profiles are considered inactive. If the value of a user profile occurs on or before this date and time, the profile is considered inactive.

member.param: One of the values, specifying whether anonymous, authenticated, or both types of profiles are returned.
A that identifies which user profiles are considered inactive. If the of a user profile occurs on or before this date and time, the profile is considered inactive.

The size of the page of results to return.

member.name: M:Testing.Commons.Web.ProfileTestProvider.SetAsDefault
member.summary: Sets the default provider () to a test provider.
member.remarks:
Invoke it once per test fixture to ease configuration of the profile system while testing.
The test provider must have been added to the collection of available providers and should be named test.

member.remarks:
Invoke it once per test fixture to ease configuration of the profile system while testing.
The test provider must have been added to the collection of available providers and should be named .
member.param: Name of the test provider.
